summary.blockquote: NOTEAlthough the interface is available outside secure contexts, the property is not, thus custom s cannot be defined outside them.

remarks.para: The AudioWorkletNode interface of the Web Audio API represents a base class for a user-defined , which can be connected to an audio routing graph along with other nodes. It has an associated , which does the actual audio processing in a Web Audio rendering thread.

-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API
-Using AudioWorklet

AudioWorkletNodeAudioWorkletNode.summary:
The AudioWorkletNode()
constructor creates a new object, which represents an
that uses a JavaScript function to perform custom audio
processing.

remarks.para:
-Web Audio API
-Background audio processing using AudioWorklet

AudioWorkletNodeParameters.value:
The object containing instances.
They can be automated in the same way as with default AudioNodes, and their
calculated values can be used in the method of your .

AudioWorkletNodePort.summary:
The read-only port property of the
interface returns the associated
. It can be used to communicate between the node and its
associated .

blockquote.para:
The port at the other end of the channel is
available under the property of the
processor.

remarks.para:
-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API

AudioWorkletNodePort.value:
The object that is connecting the
AudioWorkletNode and its associated AudioWorkletProcessor.

AudioWorkletNodeProcessorerror.summary: The processorerror event fires when the underlying behind the node throws an exception in its constructor, the method, or any user-defined class method.

remarks.para: Once an exception is thrown, the processor (and thus the node) will output silence throughout its lifetime.
